sen.j: 三条西（さんじょうにし）家は、藤原氏藤原北家閑院流の正親町三条家の分家で、大臣家（旧家、内々）の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: The House of Sanjonishi is a house of branch line of the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo of the House of Fujiwara North, Kan'in Line, and a court noble having the house status of the house of Minister (Old houses, Uchiuchi).
sen.cmt: 分家→a house of branch line[『新英和辞典』研究社]
sen.e: The House of Sanjonishi is a house of a branch line of the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo of the House of Fujiwara North, Kan'in Line, and a court noble having the house status of the house of Minister (Old houses, Uchiuchi).

The Sanjonishi Family is a house of a branch line of the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo, of the Kanin Line, of the House of Fujiwara North of the Fujiwara clan, as well as a court noble having the house status of the house of Minister (Old houses, or Uchiuchi).
sen.cmt: Fujiwara clanを追加しました。"House of Sanjonishi" -> "Sanjonishi Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 分家でありながら家格は本家の正親町三条家をしのぎ、三大臣家の中でも格別とされ、室町時代から江戸時代初期にかけ右大臣をたびたび輩出したため、その家格は清華家とほぼ同格とみなされていた。
sen.e: Although the house of branch line, the house status excelled as compared with the head family, the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo, was exceptionally ranked among the three houses of minister, and frequently produced Minister of the Right from the Muromachi period through the early Edo period, and therefore the House status was considered as approximately equivalent to Seigake.

Although the house of a branch line, the house status excelled as compared with the head family (the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo) was exceptionally ranked among the three houses of ministers, and frequently produced ministers of the right from the Muromachi period through the early Edo period; therefore, the house status was considered as being approximately equivalent to seigake.

Although in the house of a branch line the house status excelled as compared with the head family (the Ogimachi-Sanjo Family), it was exceptionally ranked among the three houses of ministers and frequently produced ministers of the right from the Muromachi period through the early Edo period; therefore, the house status was considered to be approximately equivalent to seigake (one of the statuses of court nobility that is inferior to Sekke but superior to minister).
sen.cmt: wasを追加しました。清華家の説明として (one of the statuses of court nobility which is inferiror to Sekke but superior to minister) を追加しました。"House of ～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 閑院家嫡流の転法輪三条家にも、たびたび養子をだしたため、戦国時代 (日本)以降の転法輪三条家の直接の血統は三条西家のものである。
sen.e: Since the house of Sanjonishi frequently sent children to be adopted by the House of Tenporin-Sanjo of the Kaninke main line, the direct blood line of the House of Tenporin Sanjo after the Sengoku period; the Warring States period (Japan) comes from the House of Sanjonishi.
sen.cmt: 戦国時代（日本）→Sengoku period; the Warring States period (Japan) [Japanese Historypublished 2003 by Kodansha International Ltd.]
sen.e: Since the House of Sanjonishi frequently sent children to be adopted by the House of Tenporin-Sanjo of the Kaninke main line, the direct blood line of the House of Tenporin Sanjo after the Sengoku period; the Warring States period (Japan) comes from the House of Sanjonishi.

Although in the house of a branch line the house status excelled as compared with the head family (the Ogimachi-Sanjo Family), it was exceptionally ranked among the three houses of ministers and frequently produced ministers of the right from the Muromachi period through the early Edo period; therefore, the house status was considered to be approximately equivalent to seigake (one of the statuses of court nobility that is inferior to Sekke but superior to minister).
sen.cmt: Temporin-Sanjo of the Kaninke main line としました。"House of ～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 西三条ともいう。
sen.e: Also called Nishisanjo.
It is also called Nishisanjo.
It is also called Nishisanjo.

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は502石。
sen.e: The family stipend in the Edo period is 502 koku.
The family stipend during the Edo period was 502 koku.
The family stipend during the Edo period was 502 koku.

sen.j: 明治維新後は、伯爵を授爵され西三条に改名した。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the family was granted a title, peerage of count and changed the name to Nishisanjo.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family was granted a title, peerage of count and changed the name to Nishisanjo.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family was granted a title, peerage of count and changed the name to Nishisanjo.

sen.j: しかし、後、元の三条西にもどす。
sen.e: However, later the family changed the name to the original, Sanjonishi again.
However, the family later returned its name to the original, Sanjonishi.
However, the family later returned to its original name of Sanjonishi.

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)後期、正親町三条実継の次男の大納言三条西公時を祖とする。
sen.e: In the late period of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the original forefather is Dainagon Kintoki SANJONISHI, the second son of Sanetsugu OGIMACHISANJO.
sen.cmt: 南北朝時代（日本）→the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) [Japanese Historypublished 2003 by Kodansha International Ltd.]、
sen.e: During the late Northern and Southern Courts period (Japan), the original forefather was Dainagon Kintoki SANJONISHI, who was the second son of Sanetsugu OGIMACHISANJO.

During the period of the late Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), the original forefather was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kintoki SANJONISHI, who was the second son of Sanetsugu OGIMACHISANJO.
sen.cmt: 「南北朝時代」の訳を修正。"Dainagon" -> "Dainagon (chief councilor of state)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 公時の子の三条西実清は中納言で止まったものの、その次の世代の三条西公保は本家である正親町三条家から養子に入り、生家の家格を引き継いだため、大臣家の家格を有することとなった。
sen.e: Sanekiyo SANJONISHI, child of Kintoki was promoted only to Chunagon, but in the next generation Kinyasu SANJONISHI was adopted from the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo, the head family, and inherited the House status of the biological parents' house to obtain the House status of the house of minister.

Sanekiyo SANJONISHI, the child of Kintoki, was promoted only to the post of chunagon, but in the next generation Kinyasu SANJONISHI was adopted from the House of Ogimachi-Sanjo (the head family) and inherited the house status of the biological parents' house in order to obtain the house status of a ministerial house.

Sanekiyo SANJONISHI, the child of Kintoki, was promoted only to the post of chunagon (vice-councilor of state), but in the next generation Kinyasu SANJONISHI was adopted from the Ogimachi-Sanjo Family (the head family) and inherited the house status of the biological parents' house in order to obtain the house status of a ministerial house.
sen.cmt: "House of ～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。"chunagon" -> "chunagon (vice-councilor of state)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 代々和歌に優れ、室町時代後期の三条西実隆は歌人、書家として名をなし、戦国時代 (日本)の三条西公条、三条西実枝も和漢に精通し、この3人は三条西三代と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Over generations, the family excelled in waka, in the late Muromachi period Sanetaka SANJONISHI was famous as a waka poet, calligrapher, in the Sengoku period (Japan) Kin'eda SANJONISHI and Saneeda SANJONISHI were familier with the Chinese and Japanse classics, and these three are called the three generations of Sanjonishi.
sen.cmt: 三条西公条→Kin'eda SANJONISHI [http://jiten.biglobe.ne.jp/j]、 三条西実枝→Saneeda SANJONISHI [http://jiten.biglobe.ne.jp/j]、三条西三代→the three generations of Sanjonishi [http://jiten.biglobe.ne.jp/j]
sen.e: Over the generations the family excelled in waka; in the late Muromachi period Sanetaka SANJONISHI was famous as a waka poet and calligrapher; and in the Sengoku period (Japan) Kin'eda SANJONISHI and Saneeda SANJONISHI were familiar with the Chinese and Japanese classics; these three are called the three generations of Sanjonishi.

Over the generations the family excelled in waka; in the late Muromachi period Sanetaka SANJONISHI was famous as a waka poet and calligrapher; and in the Sengoku (the Warring States) period (Japan) Kineda SANJONISHI and Saneki SANJONISHI were familiar with the Chinese and Japanese classics; these three are called the three generations of Sanjonishi.
sen.cmt: 三条西実枝→Saneki SANJONISHIとしました。戦国時代の説明として (the Warring States period)を追加しました。

sen.j: 三条西家による歌学の継承は、三条西実枝のあと、本来は三条西公国が継ぐべきであったが、まだ幼かったため、三条西実枝の高弟細川幽斎が中継ぎとして古今伝授を受け、三条西公国の成人をまって伝えた。
sen.e: After Saneeda SANJONISHI, the study of waka by the House of Sanjonishi should have been inherited by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, but since he was still young, Yusai HOSOKAWA, a high disciple of Saneeda SANJONISHI, received teachings of kokin (ancient and modern times) as an intermediary, and Yusai passed on it to Kinkuni after he became an adult.

After Saneeda SANJONISHI, the study of waka by the House of Sanjonishi should have been inherited by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, but since he was still young, Yusai HOSOKAWA, a high disciple of Saneeda SANJONISHI, received teachings in kokin (ancient and modern times) as an intermediary, and Yusai passed on it to Kinkuni once he had reached the age of adulthood.

After Saneki SANJONISHI, the study of waka by the House of Sanjonishi should have been inherited by Kinkuni SANJONISHI, but since he was still young, Yusai HOSOKAWA, a high disciple of Saneki SANJONISHI, received teachings in Kokinshu （Collection of Poems Ancient and Modern) as an intermediary, and Yusai passed it on to Kinkuni once he had reached the age of adulthood.
sen.cmt: passed it on toと修正しました。Sanekiに修正しました。古今伝授を received teachings in Kokinshu （Collection of Poems Ancient and Modern) としました。

sen.j: しかし、三条西公国が早世したため、幽斎は師実枝との生前の約束を誠実に果たし、再び三条西実条に伝えなおしている。
sen.e: However, since Kinkuni SANJONISHI died young, Yusai honestly kept a promise that was made between Yusai and his master Saneeda before he died, and Yusai passed on it again to Sane'eda SANJONISHI.
However, since Kinkuni SANJONISHI died young, Yusai kept a promise that was made between Yusai and his master Saneeda before he died, and Yusai passed it on to Sane'eda SANJONISHI.
However, because Kinkuni SANJONISHI had died young, Yusai kept a promise that was made between Yusai and his master Saneki before he died, and Yusai passed it on to Saneeda SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 三条西実条のあとは三条西実教が継いだ。
sen.e: After Saneeda SANJONISHI, Sanenori SANJONISHI inherited it.
After Saneeda SANJONISHI, it was inherited by Sanenori SANJONISHI.
After Saneeda SANJONISHI, it was inherited by Sanenori SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 以降、江戸期を通して歌道は三条西家の家職的学問となる。
sen.e: Thereafter, through the Edo period the art of waka became the House of Sanjonishi's studies of the family business.
Thereafter, through the Edo period the art of waka became the House of Sanjonishi's studies of the family business.
Thereafter, through the Edo period the art of waka became the Sanjonishi Family's studies of the family business.

sen.j: 近年、藤原定家の子孫としては、冷泉家が有名ではあるが、実際には、室町時代から明治期にいたるまで、二条家正嫡流を伝承する三条西家が、定家の後継者として、歌壇の主流を占めた。
sen.e: In recent year, as descendant of FUJIWARA NO Teika, the house of Reizei is famous, but in fact, from the Muromachi period through Meiji period, the house of Sanjonishi, that passes head and branch lines of the House of NIJO on, was the main stream of poet circles as successor of Teika.

In recent years, as descendant of FUJIWARA NO Teika, the house of Reizei is famous; however, from the Muromachi period through the Meiji period the house of Sanjonishi, which passes on the head and branch lines of the House of NIJO, was the main stream of poet circles as successor to Teika.

In recent years, the Reizei Family has become famous for being descended from FUJIWARA no Teika; however, from the Muromachi period through the Meiji period the house of Sanjonishi, which passed on the traditions of the head and branch lines of the NIJO Family, was the mainstream of poetry as the successor to Teika.
sen.cmt: was the main stream of poet circles' の意味を明確にしました。"House of～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: （この二条家とは、摂関家の二条家ではなく、まったくの別流である。
sen.e: (This House of Nijo is a totally different line from the House of Nijo of the Sekkan (Regent and Senior Regent) Houses.
(This House of Nijo was a totally different line from the House of Nijo of the Sekkan (regent and senior regent) houses.
(This Nijo Family was a totally different line from the Nijo Family of the Sekkan (regent and senior regent) houses.

sen.j: 別名の御子左家といったほうが、わかりやすかもしれない。
sen.e: It might become clearer to say that it is the House of Mikohidari-ke in different name.
It might become clearer to say that it was the House of Mikohidari-ke with a different name.
It might become clearer to say that it was the Mikohidari Family with a different name.
sen.cmt: "House of Mikohidari-ke" -> "Mikohidari Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、家としては、室町時代初期に断絶したため、三条西家がその学統を継いだ。
sen.e: However, as a family lineage, this family line failed in the early Muromachi period, and therefore the house of Sanjonishi inherited this academic lineage.
However, as a lineage this family line failed in the early Muromachi period, and therefore the house of Sanjonishi inherited this academic lineage.
However, as a lineage this family line failed in the early Muromachi period, and therefore the Sanjonishi family inherited this academic lineage.

sen.j: 冷泉家は京極家とともに、この二条家の分家にあたる。
sen.e: The House of Reizei, together with the House of Kyogoku, is a branch family of this House of Nijo.
The House of Reizei, together with the House of Kyogoku, was a branch family of this House of Nijo.
The Reizei Family, together with the Kyogoku Family, was a branch family of this Nijo Family.

sen.j: ）また、香道の家としても一家をなした。
sen.e: ) Besides, the family was also a family of the art of scent.
) Additionally, the family was notable in the art of fragrance.
) Additionally, the family was notable in the art of fragrance.

sen.j: 現在では、歌道よりも、御家流香道宗家として有名になっている。
sen.e: At present, the House is famous as the head house of Oie style art of scent rather than the study of waka.
Currently, the House is famous as the head house of Oie style art of fragrance rather than the study of waka.
Currently, the House is famous as the head house of Oie style art of fragrance rather than the study of waka.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期の女性で、江戸幕府3代征夷大将軍・徳川家光の乳母として有名な春日局も三条西家に縁のある人物で、三条西実条と猶妹の縁組をし、公卿である三条西家の息女として御所に参内し、局号を許された。
sen.e: Kasuga no Tsubone, who is a woman in the early Edo period and is famous as menoto, a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby, of the third generation shogun of the Edo Shogunate Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, was also related to the House of Sanjonishi, she made an arrangement to become an adopted sister of Sane'eda SANJONISHI, and started serving the Imperial Palace as a daughter of the House of Sanjonishi, and was given the title of Tsubone.

Kasuga no Tsubone, a woman in the early Edo period who gained notoriety as a menoto (a woman providing breastfeeding to a highborn baby) of the third-generation shogun of the Edo shogunate, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, was also related to the House of Sanjonishi, she made an arrangement to become an adopted sister of Sane'eda SANJONISHI; thus she started serving the Imperial Palace as a daughter of the House of Sanjonishi, and was given the title of Tsubone.

Kasuga no Tsubone, a woman in the early Edo period who gained notoriety as a menoto (a woman providing breastfeeding to a highborn baby) of the third-generation Shogun of the Edo shogunate, Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, was also related to the Sanjonishi Family; she made an arrangement to become an adopted sister of Saneeda SANJONISHI, whereupon she served the Imperial Palace as a daughter of the Sanjonishi Family and was given the title of Tsubone.
sen.cmt: 文章のつながりを修正しました。"House of～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 幕末期の当主は三条西季知で、いわゆる七卿落ちの一人として維新に際して勲功があり、また明治天皇の和歌師範としても有名である。
sen.e: The family head at the end of the Edo period is Suetomo SANJONISHI, who made achivements in Meiji Restoration as one of the so-called exile of the Seven nobles, and he is also famous as a waka master of Emperor Meiji.

The family head at the end of the Edo period was Suetomo SANJONISHI, who made achievements in the Meiji Restoration as one of the so-called exiles of the seven nobles, and gained fame as a waka master of Emperor Meiji.

The family head at the end of the Edo period was Suetomo SANJONISHI, who had many achievements in the Meiji Restoration as one of the so-called exiles of the seven nobles, and who gained fame as a waka master of the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: made achievements' をhad many achievementsにしました。

sen.j: 昭和の当主・三条西公正は、実践女子大学教授などを勤める一方、御家流香道宗家として香道の復興・発展に尽力した。
sen.e: The family head in the Showa period is Kimimasa SANJONISHI, who worked as a professor of Jissen Women's University and also worked hard to try to restore and develop the art of scent as the head house of Oie style art of scent.

The family head in the Showa period was Kimimasa SANJONISHI, who worked as a professor at Jissen Women's University and dedicated considerable effort to restoring and nurturing the art of fragrance as the head house of the Oie-style art of fragrance.

The family head in the Showa period was Kimimasa SANJONISHI, who worked as a professor at Jissen Women's University and dedicated considerable effort to restoring and nurturing the art of fragrance as the head house of the Oie-style art of fragrance.

sen.j: 公正夫人は、香淳皇后の妹にあたる久邇宮信子女王である。
sen.e: Kimimasa's wife is Princess Kuninomiya Nobuko who is a younger sister of Empress Kojun.
Kimimasa's wife is Princess Kuninomiya Nobuko, a younger sister of Empress Kojun.
Kimimasa's wife is Princess Kuninomiya Nobuko, a younger sister of Empress Kojun.

sen.j: 公正のあとを継いだのが三条西実謙であり、実謙もまた香道の発展に尽力した。
sen.e: Those who inherited Kimimasa is Sanekane SANJONISHI, and Sanekane also worked hard for the development of the art of scent.
Kimimasa was inherited by Sanekane SANJONISHI, and Sanekane also worked hard in developing the art of fragrance.
Kimimasa was inherited by Sanekane SANJONISHI, and Sanekane also worked hard in developing the art of fragrance.

sen.j: 実謙の弟、実栄は母方のおじの家である久邇邦久を継承している。
sen.e: Jitsuei, younger brother of Sanekane, inherited Kunihisa KUNI who is the maternal aunt's house.
sen.cmt: 実栄→定訳不明(Jitsueiとしました）
sen.e: Jitsuei, the younger brother of Sanekane, inherited Kunihisa KUNI, which is the maternal aunt's house.
Jitsuei, the younger brother of Sanekane, inherited Kunihisa KUNI, which is the maternal aunt's house.

sen.j: 現当主は三条西公彦であり、香道を広める活動を積極的に行っている。
sen.e: The current family head is Kinyoshi SANJONISHI who is active for the spread of the art of scent.
sen.cmt: 三条西公彦→定訳不明（Kinyoshi SANJONISHIとしました）
sen.e: The current family head is Kinyoshi SANJONISHI, who is active in spreading the art of fragrance.
The current family head is Kinyoshi SANJONISHI, who is active in spreading the art of fragrance.

sen.j: 三条西家の文書は、学習院大学、東京大学、国立公文書館、国立国文学歴史資料館、早稲田大学、カリフォルニア大学、天理大学、日本大学などの各研究機関に分散所有されている。
sen.e: Written documents of the House of Sanjonishi are decentrally-housed in study institutes including Gakushuin University, The University of Tokyo, The National Archives of Japan, Kokuritsu Kokubungaku Rekishi Shiryoukan, Waseda University, University of California, Tenri University, and Nihon University.
sen.cmt: 国立公文書館→The National Archives of Japan [公式サイト]、国立国文学歴史資料館→定訳不明
sen.e: Written documents of the House of Sanjonishi are variously housed in institutions such as Gakushuin University, the University of Tokyo, the National Archives of Japan, Kokuritsu Kokubungaku Rekishi Shiryoukan, Waseda University, University of California, Tenri University and Nihon University.

Written documents of the Sanjonishi Family are variously housed in institutions such as Gakushuin University, the University of Tokyo, the National Archives of Japan, Kokuritsu Kokubungaku Rekishi Shiryoukan, Waseda University, University of California, Tenri University and Nihon University.
